name: Memories in Melody
description:
Get ready for this narrative driven game made by a wee group for IWM's War games jam, a game jam spanning the 13th-20th of February 2023. The item collection theme for the jam was revealled at kick-off!

Collection Item: The Western Front Violin

The Great War brought many tragedies and horror across Europe, and many lives were lost in the destruction. Despite the destruction, there is still hope, there is still life. War can be crafted into peace whilst never being forgotten.

Memories in melody is a jam game about carving a violin while revisiting memories of world war one. This game was inspired by The Western Front Violin (© IWM EPH 709), crafted in 1983. Its wood was carved from trees growing on former battlefields of the Western Front in France and Belgium. The trees were found to be more than 80 years olds, their roots surviving the devastation of the First World War.

This instrument was inspired by Kenneth Popplewell, a professional violinist and was used as a memorial to those who died during the war. Lent to the Imperial War Museum, the violin was frequently played at commemorative events at the museum, including on Armistice Day and Remembrance Sunday. Following Popplewell’s death, it was donated to the museum.

Controls

Click Mouse (LMB) move the mouse while clicking to carve
Middle Mouse Button to rotate the wooden block
